meanings.definition: The amount of space that a substance or object occupies.
meanings.sent1: The box took up so much volumes in the closet.
meanings.sent2: The jar had a small volume, so it couldn't hold many marbles.
meanings.sent3: The balloon animal had such a large volume that it filled the entire room!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, filling it with volumes of joy.
meanings.sent5: The mountain of pillows created a cozy nook, adding volumes of comfort to the room.

meanings.definition: A book forming part of a work or series.
meanings.sent1: The library had many volumes of the famous series.
meanings.sent2: She borrowed the first volume of the fantasy series from the library.
meanings.sent3: The volumes on the shelf seemed to whisper stories to each other.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a volume of knowledge waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The worn-out volume held within its pages the secrets of generations past.

meanings.definition: The amount of sound produced by a speaker or musical instrument.
meanings.sent1: The concert hall was filled with volumes of music.
meanings.sent2: The speaker produced a low volume that was hard to hear.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meow reached volumes that surprised everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her voice carried volumes of emotion that touched the audience.
meanings.sent5: The orchestra played with such volumes that the audience was moved to tears.
